intro: Sicyocarya kokocrateris, commonly known as the Kokocrater starfish, is a unique marine invertebrate belonging to the family Asteriidae. It is characterized by its distinctive radial symmetry and a central disc surrounded by arms. The species is typically found in shallow, rocky coastal areas where it thrives on rocky substrates. Its coloration can vary, often featuring a mix of brown and orange hues. Sicyocarya kokocrateris plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to the ecological balance through its feeding habits.
